description: From Latin tertius (“third”); the tertial feathers are the third row of feathers.

entries.meaning: (ornithology) Any flight feather attached to the humerus (upper arm) of a bird.
examples: He continues — "There was the same rear up, with the head bent down, followed by an upjerk of the hind parts; the long sickle-shaped tertials, so noticeable in this species, seemed little if at all expanded,  […]
